perturbation.original_text: Following the completion of such maintenance term, Bankers Bank may, at its option, renew maintenance for subsequent periods of one (1) year each, subject to adjustments proposed by Netzee not to exceed 5% at least sixty (60) days in advance of the applicable renewal date.
perturbation.changed_text: Following the completion of such maintenance term, Bankers Bank may, at its option, renew maintenance for subsequent periods of one (1) year each, subject to adjustments proposed by Netzee not to exceed 20% at least fifteen (15) days in advance of the applicable renewal date.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the notification period for renewal adjustments from 60 days to 15 days and increases the maximum adjustment percentage from 5% to 20%. This could be considered an unreasonably short notice period and an excessive potential price increase under general contract law principles, potentially contradicting requirements for good faith and fair dealing depending on the specific jurisdiction (Georgia).
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles (Good Faith and Fair Dealing)

perturbation.original_text: Maintenance provided by Netzee during the term of this Agreement shall include (2) 5x12 call-in support between hours of 6:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. Eastern Time Monday through Friday
perturbation.changed_text: Maintenance provided by Netzee during the term of this Agreement shall include (2) sporadic call-in support between the company's chosen hours during weekdays.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies clear support hours (6:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday-Friday). The modification introduces vague and arbitrary support availability. It violates basic contract law principles that dictate the terms of the service should be reasonably specific.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic Contract Law Principles (Specificity of Terms)

perturbation.original_text: and (4) availability of basic Services with at least 99% uptime between 4:00 a.m Monday and 7:00 p.m. Friday and between 8:00 a.m. Saturday and 2:00 p.m. Saturday Eastern Time, exclusive of outages caused by off-peak prescheduled maintenance or causes beyond Netzee's reasonable control (including third-party equipment or communications).
perturbation.changed_text: and (4) availability of basic Services with uptime as determined by Netzee.
perturbation.explanation: The original text commits to a specific uptime percentage (99%) during defined hours. The modification gives Netzee complete discretion over uptime, removing any guarantee of service level. This lack of specificity may render the clause unenforceable and contradicts standard service level agreement (SLA) expectations, which typically require clearly defined uptime commitments.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law Principles (Enforceability, Specificity of Terms, Good Faith and Fair Dealing)
